comment: He's a cool guy and very passionate. The assignments are lengthy but thats any professor for this course, just pick a good group. Honestly, I didn't pay attention a single day in this class and got a B. He takes attendance for extra credit. His exams are online no lockdown but final exam is in person. He cares most about assignments.

I had no experience in the weight room prior to taking him for lab during the summer, but Dr. Mangine was still patient with me and provided good feedback to help me improve in the class. Aside from lab assignments, he grades three practical exams. I failed one of them and still received an A in the class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: For lecture: Long semester group project so start on it early. 5 quizzes. 3 tests. Jeopard review games for extra points For lab: Semester group project which was pretty easy. 5 quizzes. 3 practicals. He grades too hard on the practicals. Doesn't respond to emails very quickly. He is a nice guy but seems to grade inconsistently among individuals.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Tests & Quizzes are nothing compared to the assignments. The assignments take time so START EARLY! The 3 part assignment is graded heavily. 1st and 2nd not so bad, 3rd is several pages long (word document with tables), around 10-20 pages. He grades strictly on it too. Make sure to do the jeopardy games for extra credit to make sure you keep an A!

Focuses a lot of assignments and grades the last assignment SUPER hard. Does not answer emails fast and I had to email him twice multiple times just to get a response. Gives some extra credit but divides your points earned during those sessions by 3. I wouldnt take him if you arent super interested or knowledgeable about S&C bc he expects a lot.

Mangine is an awesome guy. He is passionate about his field and research studies. Overall the tests were easy, but make sure to put time into the assignments and programs he assigns, because the final program is a big chunk of your grade. You will enjoy this class and learn a lot of good information from it.

Great professor! His teaching style is on-point, explains things well, and quite professional. The class is powerpoint heavy, but great. I took this class in the Summer, and I believe this is not his normal course, but nontheless a great professor and great course. I recommend it overall.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Mangine is super passionate about the field. With that being said, he often spends an excessive amount of time on the smallest details. Testing is supposed to be in the lab every time. However he replaced 7 classes with lectures instead. Fails you if you miss more than 5 classes... His final is 70% of the course but Testing itself is easy.

Dr. Mangine is super knowledgable in S&C. He cares more about you understanding the material than the grades you get in his class. Therefore, his tests (including the final) are identical to the practice quizzes, he grades leniently, and provides extra credit for attendance. He is a super nice guy that challenges you to think if you care in lecture

Mangine is a really cool professor and makes class fun. His tests were inconsistent. I made a 100 on the first test and made C's and B's after that even though I studied the exact same way. He gives free test answers but sometimes the answers would be wrong. Semester long group projects.

Awesome teacher! He makes lectures so fun and entertaining. He gives you plenty of times to get extra points all you have to do is attend and do the work and quizzes! You get 3 chances to get a better score on quizzes! Reviews are very helpful as well. I've learned so much and I'm really going to miss having him after I graduate! Go Mangine!!!

Dr. Mangine is awesome. He makes his lectures entertaining and easy to understand. Exams are fair, def have to study for the course but he gives reviews and online quizzes that prepare you for the exam. Attendance is extra credit which can make a difference if you are borderline! Look forward to taking him again of Ex phys 2. He's a nice guy.
Lot's of homework. But nice guy. Really wants to make the best of it everything and wants everyone to learn.
